conclusion: Analyze the motion of balls on inclined plane to determine number of balls rolling on top of ball A.
Time interval between release of each ball is 0.1 seconds.
Distance AB is 15 cm and distance BC is 20 cm.
Velocity of ball B is 150 cm/s calculated using distance AB and time interval.
Balls are identical and incline is uniform, causing consistent velocity difference between consecutive balls.
Ball A is released 0.1 seconds after ball B, and ball B travels 15 cm in these 0.1 seconds.
Ball C is released 0.1 seconds after ball B and travels 20 cm in that time, indicating it is further down the incline.
Ball A is the reference point, balls C and B are below A.
Determine release sequence: balls are released in order C, B, A.
Two balls (C and B) are below A, and one ball is above A in the sequence before C.
Number of balls rolling on top of ball A is one.
